sentences.english: It's the Bigs against the Smalls, and it's the guards doing.
sentences.chinese: 大个子和小个子有对立之处，但基本上是后卫在唱戏。

sentences.english: All Road Arts set up the stage, singing the economy.
sentences.chinese: 都道艺术搭台，经济唱戏。

sentences.english: Unlike my nephew your Crown Prince who only knows to sing and dance.
sentences.chinese: 不像朕的侄儿，也就是你们的太子，只会唱戏。

sentences.english: My father likes sing songs and dramas. He can sing well until now.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲喜欢唱歌和唱戏，到现在他还能唱的很好。

sentences.english: Grinding mill, not just to use.
sentences.chinese: 磨粉磨不细，就去学唱戏。

sentences.english: Why do they dress like performers in Chinese opera?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他们要穿得像个唱戏的？

sentences.english: The time for breathing and breathing method in singing of opera singers.
sentences.chinese: 他唱戏时很讲究呼吸的运用。

definition: to attend an opera/to see an opera
erhua variant of 名角[ming2 jue2]
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
folk art consisting of storytelling to music
to weep before a coffin or a memorial to the dead
